author: peter.davies
content: Address space extension is going to break the ECRECOVER precompile to the point that we will need to introduce a ECRECOVER2 precompile. Do account abstraction people have any opinions about the future of ECRECOVER? I assume AA will break it again and it would be nice if we weren't forced to introduce a ECRECOVER3 precompile.

author: peter.davies
content: The ASE problem is we need to introduce an epoch number argument so the precompile knows which address to recover to.

author: sky.cactus
content: I think the persona idea could make it so we don't actually need to break ECRECOVER?

author: peter.davies
content: The problem is contracts need to be able to recover other people's signatures, regardless of whether their addresses are Legacy, Epoch 0, Epoch 1, etc...

author: sky.cactus
content: Yeah, you would just specify which persona you will recover to with the transaction.

author: sky.cactus
content: Ecrecover is provided a signature, and the transaction is bundled with a signed bit of data that says "when ecrecover recovers my public key, have it return this one of my addresses".
